result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Bosman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to case no. 16CT65. Concurrent with case nos. 16CM171, 16CF129, 17CF172.

miscConds.notes: Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.

records.addlTxt: Defendant William R Bosman in court with attorney Christa E Johnson. Defendant William R Bosman in custody. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant in custody.

Originally set for sentencing. Defendant William R Bosman appeared by phone. Attorney Christa E Johnson appeared in Court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that cases were to be completed today, advises that Defendant was in court when date was set and was sent notification last week. Defendant advises that paperwork does not have time, called today, can't be here until this afternoon. State requests bench warrant. Defense is not available this afternoon, requests additional time for Defendant to appear. Court issues warrant, will not sign until next week. Discussion regarding rescheduling. Court issues bench warrant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant William R Bosman in court with attorney Christa E Johnson. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that Defendant needs additional time to get restitution paid, needs time to get on the same page with the Defense regarding all matters.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 13, 2017 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William R Bosman
Current: 216 S. 18th Ave, Apt. 5L, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2017)
Prior: 726 Rhode Island Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States

Defendant William R Bosman in court with attorney Christa E Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement, agreement to put off sentencing to allow Defendant to pay restitution. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant William R Bosman in court with attorney Christa Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of commitment order, advises that Defendant is working, has substantial amount of restitution due, agreed to set case off for month to allow Defendant to make payment of at least $1000 toward that restitution, has no objection to putting off hearing. Discussion regarding commitment orders/financial obligations.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant William R Bosman in court with attorney Christa Johnson. Defendant William R Bosman in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that offer has been accepted but there are details to work out, requests that bond be converted in case no. 16-CM-171.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant William R Bosman in court with attorney Christa Johnson. Defendant William R Bosman in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that she has additional things to do regarding offers/discovery, requests status in 60 days.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant William R Bosman appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 10/13/16, 11:30.
